REVIEW: Crepe Suzette served at Le Coin des Crêpes in Cape Town presented a harmonious blend of tastes. The crepe, expertly crafted, boasted a feather-light and dainty consistency, striking the perfect balance between being overly thin or excessively thick. Accompanying it was an orange-caramel sauce that pleasantly surprised with its sweet and subtly tart flavor, complementing the crepe exceptionally well. Yet, the presentation fell slightly short of expectations, lacking the visual allure typically associated with a dish of such renown. All things considered, the meal proved satisfactory, though enhancements could be made in the realm of aesthetics.

トキョー ruby ユーザー レビュー:Not the Wurst Hot Dogs という店、ホットドッグが好きなのでオーダーしました。しかし、日本のホットドッグの名前がNEW YORK DOGとコーニードッグであるようです。ニューヨークはもちろん美味しいけど、日本のホットドッグという名前の意味がわかりませんでした。さらに、瓶詰めソーダも普通のソーダと同じくらいの味でした。もう1度思い直した方がいいと思います。Translation:Tokyo Ruby user review:I ordered from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs because I like hot dogs. However, the names of the hot dogs are NEW YORK DOG and COONY DOG, which are names of hot dogs in Japan. Of course, New York hot dogs are delicious, but I don't understand the meaning of the name "Japanese hot dogs". Furthermore, the bottled soda tasted no different from regular soda. I think they should reconsider.

Creamy Chicken and Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Mumbai Meet Expectations. The Creamy Chicken Ramen presents a rich, velvety broth, well-seasoned, while Tonkotsu Ramen boasts a hearty, pork-based broth. Noodles in both dishes cooked to the right consistency, providing a satisfying bite. Accompanying bottled soda offers a refreshing complement to the meal. Overall, a satisfactory experience, with dishes delivering on promised flavors.

Delightful finds in London include the Better Off Bread truck. A standout was the Italian sandwich, a hot ham and cheese treat, boasting fresh, flavorful ingredients. The bread's soft, fluffy texture complemented the generous, satisfying fillings. A bottled soda was the perfect, refreshing complement to the sandwich. Overall, a highly positive experience at Better Off Bread, making it a top recommendation for anyone in search of a delicious sandwich in London.

Crepes from Le Coin des Crêpes were disappointing. Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and its ingredients were not fresh. Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was even worse, with a bland filling encased in a soggy crepe. The bottled soda was the only redeeming feature of the order. Not worth a visit in Krakow.

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The Coney Dog lacked the expected chili punch, the Chicago Dog was overpowered by pickles, and the New York Dog was a far cry from the authentic street-style taste. The hot dogs were lukewarm, and the buns were soggy, making the overall experience underwhelming. Krakow has better options for hot dog lovers.

A culinary delight in Delhi is the "Guac n' Roll" truck. The Chicken Burrito, an ordered treat, boasted a harmonious blend of flavors. The tender chicken, fresh veggies, and creamy guacamole harmoniously wrapped in a soft tortilla resulted in a scrumptious meal. The portion size was generous, and the service was swift and friendly. A must-visit for taco enthusiasts, the truck's quality and taste are top-notch. Craving for the next burrito from Guac n' Roll has already set in.

"Nani's Kitchen truly delivered an authentic Indian culinary experience right in the heart of Delhi! The Tandoori Mixed Grill was a flavorful symphony, each piece perfectly marinated and grilled to tender perfection. The Combination Curry was a delightful medley of spices, offering a comforting warmth that was simply irresistible. The truck's inviting ambiance complemented the delicious food, making for a memorable dining experience. Nani's Kitchen is a must-visit for anyone craving genuine Indian cuisine. Well done!"

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The tandoori mixed grill was a letdown, with a lack of moisture and flavor. The combination curry failed to impress as well, with its uninspired taste. The only positive aspect was the bottled soda.Service was also subpar, with lengthy wait times and an inattentive staff.Overall, Nani's Kitchen did not meet expectations, and I would not recommend it.

The food from this order was incredibly bland and flavorless. The Lo Mein and Fried Rice were both lacking in any real substance or seasoning, making them incredibly unappetizing. The Wonton Soup was the only item that had any semblance of flavor, but even that was weak and underwhelming. Overall, the food was not satisfactory and I would not recommend this service to anyone.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Hamburg was an absolute delight! The ramen was cooked to perfection, with the noodles having just the right amount of chewiness. The creamy chicken broth was rich and flavorful, yet not overpowering, allowing the taste of the tender chicken pieces to shine through. The accompanying vegetables added a refreshing crunch, making each spoonful a well-balanced, satisfying experience. The service was prompt and friendly, making the dining experience all the more enjoyable. Kitakata Ramen Bar has truly mastered the art of ramen. Highly recommended!

"Le Coin des Crêpes is a culinary delight nestled in London. The Crepe Suzette was a perfect blend of sweet and tangy, a true testament to their culinary prowess. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was an innovative twist, offering a savory experience that was both comforting and satisfying. The Breakfast Crepe was a delightful start to the day, fresh and filling. The bottled water was a refreshing accompaniment. The quality of food and variety of menu items make this truck a must-visit. Exceptional service and delicious food, Le Coin des Crêpes has certainly set the bar high!"

A delightful encounter with the Tandoori Mixed Grill at Nani's Kitchen in Melbourne. The tandoori chicken, lamb, and vegetables exhibited rich flavors and tender textures, harmoniously blending spice and sweetness. The naan bread was freshly prepared, boasting a soft and airy consistency. The rice was cooked to perfection, offering a fluffy and slightly sticky bite. Service was characterized by friendliness and attentiveness, while the atmosphere was warm and inviting. In conclusion, the Tandoori Mixed Grill at Nani's Kitchen is an Indian dining experience not to be missed in Melbourne.

"Better Off Bread" truck in Cape Town provides a straightforward menu centered around sandwiches. The Pastrami sandwich, ordered twice, boasts a generous filling with a harmonious blend of meat and condiments. The Italian sandwich exhibits potential with its tasty mix of ingredients. Accompanying bottled sodas and iced teas prove refreshing. However, the experience lacks a standout quality, serving as a solid, dependable option for a speedy meal, but not distinct from other sandwich alternatives in the region.

The "Better Off Bread" truck in Seoul offered a selection of sandwiches that was satisfactory. The Italian sandwich had a good balance of flavors, while the Hot Ham & Cheese was adequately prepared. The beverages, including bottled water, soda, and iced tea, were standard. The truck's service was neither exceptional nor poor. Overall, it was a typical food truck experience, providing a decent meal without any notable highs or lows.

This order was an absolute disaster. The seitan wings were dry and flavorless, and the salad was nowhere near all salads - it was a glorified pile of limp lettuce and a few sad-looking tomatoes. The delivery was late, and the driver was rude. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

A pleasure to discover in Warsaw, Mac Shack's truck, named "The Mac Shack," offers an appealing menu concentrated mainly on mac and cheese options. Indulging in the lobster mac and cheese, I was impressed by the ample amount of fresh lobster and melted cheese. Equally satisfying was the standard mac and cheese, which boasted a rich and flavorful creaminess. The ice tea provided a delightful respite, perfectly chilled and refreshing. The ambiance was cheerful and inclusive, and the service proved prompt and proficient. Thus, I wholeheartedly suggest Mac Shack for anybody seeking a filling and savory meal.

The Better Off Bread truck in Seattle delivered a satisfying assortment of sandwiches on my recent visit. The pastrami, hot ham, and Italian sandwiches were all generously filled with fresh and flavorful ingredients. The bread was warm and fluffy, and the toppings were perfectly balanced to enhance the overall flavor of each sandwich. The service was friendly and efficient, and the prices were reasonable. Overall, I would highly recommend Better Off Bread for anyone seeking a quick and satisfying sandwich in Seattle.

Better Off Bread truck is a Cape Town gem, offering mouth-watering sandwiches that are perfect for any occasion. The Pastrami and Italian sandwiches are standouts, with the pastrami being tender and flavorful, and the Italian sandwich packed with fresh, crispy ingredients. The bread is soft and perfectly toasted, and the overall presentation is impeccable. The friendly staff are also a delight to interact with. Highly recommend checking out Better Off Bread for a delicious and satisfying sandwich experience in Cape Town.

Peking Truck, a hidden gem nestled in Cape Town, offers an authentic and delectable Chinese menu. The Combo Lo Mein stands out, boasting perfect seasoning and a flawless cook. Another highlight is the Wonton Soup, featuring flavorful wontons in a soothing broth. Generous portions and reasonable prices make this spot a must-try for a gratifying and scrumptious meal.

Kitakata Ramen Bar is a gem in Mumbai's culinary scene! Their Tonkotsu Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen are nothing short of extraordinary. The rich, creamy broth, perfectly cooked noodles, and flavorful toppings created a harmonious symphony of tastes. The spicy miso ramen was a delightful surprise, offering a fiery twist to the traditional dish. Even the bottled water served was refreshing, complementing the meal perfectly. Kitakata Ramen Bar has undoubtedly set a high standard for ramen in the city. A must-visit for all ramen lovers!

The Kitakata Ramen Bar experience was a disappointment. The Ice Tea lacked flavor and was too watered down. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was far from creamy, with a thin, lackluster broth and tough chicken. The Tonkotsu Ramen, which should have been the star, was disappointingly bland and the noodles were overcooked. The only saving grace was the bottled water, but that's hardly something to write home about. Overall, a subpar dining experience in Mumbai.

"Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crêpes, Delhi failed to impress. The crepe was dry, flaky, and the filling lacked flavor. The chicken was tough, chewy, and the pie crust was soggy. Overall, the crepe was of poor quality and not worth recommending."

The Tasty Tibs truck in Sao Paulo delivered a satisfying Ethiopian meal. The Lean Beef Tibs were flavorful, with a nice balance of spices, and the meat was tender. The Veggie Combo, on the other hand, was a bit underwhelming. While the vegetables were fresh, they lacked the robust seasoning that one might expect from Ethiopian cuisine. Overall, the experience was pleasant, but there's certainly room for improvement in terms of consistency across dishes.

Ordering from Le Coin des Crêpes in São Paulo provides a range of beverages and crepes. Bottled Soda, Ice Tea, and Bottled Water were all present and consistent with expectations. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a delightful surprise, combining the savory taste of a pot pie with the light and tender texture of a crepe. The Breakfast Crepe, however, was a traditional option, executed competently but not especially noteworthy. Overall, the experience was enjoyable, with the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe being the highlight.

The Mac Shack in New York City delivered a satisfying mac and cheese experience. The Lobster Mac & Cheese offered a delightful twist to the classic dish, with generous chunks of lobster that added a touch of elegance. The Standard Mac & Cheese, on the other hand, was a comforting, creamy delight that stayed true to its traditional roots. However, both dishes could have benefited from a slightly crispier top layer for added texture. Overall, The Mac Shack serves up enjoyable meals that are worth trying.

The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe and Crepe Suzette from Le Coin des Crêpes in Berlin presented a unique twist on traditional crepes. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe offered a savory experience with its creamy filling and flaky crust, while the Crepe Suzette provided a sweet contrast with its citrusy flavor and caramelized sugar. The presentation was simple yet appealing. However, the crepes could have been served a bit warmer. Overall, it was an interesting gastronomic adventure, blending classic French cuisine with modern creativity.

King Combo, Greek Salad, and bottled water provided an enjoyable dining experience. The meat in the King Combo was tender and carried rich flavors. Pita bread, served warm and fresh, accompanied the dish perfectly. The Greek Salad offered a refreshing alternative, boasting a harmonious blend of vegetables and dressing. Bottled water and ice tea were excellent beverage options. This order is worth recommending for those seeking a filling and satisfying meal.

While I was excited to try the smoky BBQ truck "Smoky BBQ" in Paris, my experience was sadly disappointing. The meat, primarily the rack of pork ribs, was tough and overly dry, lacking the tenderness I'd hoped for. The sides, including the two meat plate and three meat plate, were equally uninspired, lacking flavor and creativity. The only saving grace was the refreshing iced tea and bottled soda. Overall, I wouldn't recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone seeking a satisfying and flavorful barbecue experience.

The Peking Truck's combo fried rice and wonton soup were an absolute delight. Fried rice was perfectly cooked with fresh vegetables and tender chicken. Wonton soup was steaming hot and flavorful, with delicate wontons. The overall quality of the food and the friendly service made my experience truly enjoyable. I highly recommend this truck to anyone looking for authentic Chinese cuisine in Madrid.

"Tasty Tibs truly lives up to its name! The Ethiopian menu offered a delightful culinary journey right in the heart of Madrid. The Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs were flavorful and tender, perfectly complemented by the refreshing Ice Tea and Bottled Water. The Veggie Combo was a standout, bursting with freshness and a medley of flavors. The Bottled Soda added a sweet finish to the meal. The quality of food and drinks was top-notch. A must-try for anyone seeking an authentic Ethiopian dining experience!"

Tasty Tibs truck in Rio de Janeiro presents a delightful Ethiopian culinary journey. Both the Lean Chicken Tibs and Veggie Combo were executed well, providing a gratifying dining experience. The chicken's tenderness and rich flavor were complemented by fresh, crisp vegetables. Accompanied by refreshing bottled water, the overall food quality and service excellence resulted in a pleasant meal.

The Cheeky Greek truck's menu offerings, including the gyro plate, Greek salad, and the king combo, were flavorful and satisfying. The gyro meat was tender and well-marinated, while the salad was fresh and crisp. The king combo, which included a gyro, a falafel wrap, and a side of fries, was a hearty and filling option. The bottled soda selection was extensive, and the service was friendly and prompt. Overall, the Cheeky Greek truck provides a convenient and enjoyable dining experience for those seeking Greek cuisine in Denver.

Guac n' Roll truck in Hamburg provided a taco combo plate experience that was satisfactory. Both the Three Taco Combo Plate and the Two Taco Combo Plate were prepared adequately, featuring fresh ingredients and a balanced flavor profile. However, the presentation was unremarkable, failing to truly distinguish itself. The service was efficient, falling neither in the exceptionally fast nor slow category. In summary, the meal was decent but didn't quite leave a lasting impression.

Creamy Chicken Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sydney fell short of expectations. Chicken's overcooked texture made it tough to chew. The ramen's creaminess was absent. Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen failed to deliver as well. Its spice level was insignificant, and vegetables were undercooked. The meal's taste and quality did not meet the promises made by the menu.

"Le Coin des Crêpes is a delightful find in Sao Paulo! The Crepe Suzette and Breakfast Crepe were absolutely delicious. The crepes were perfectly thin and cooked to golden perfection, filled with fresh, high-quality ingredients. The Crepe Suzette had a wonderful balance of sweet and tangy flavors, while the Breakfast Crepe was a satisfying savory option. The truck's charming ambiance added to the overall experience. I highly recommend Le Coin des Crêpes for anyone seeking authentic, tasty crepes."

Nani's Kitchen in Sao Paulo served up a flavorful delight with their Tandoori Mixed Grill and Combination Curry. The mixed grill featured tender, succulent chicken and vegetables, all marinated in a vibrant tandoori sauce and cooked to perfection in a tandoor oven. Accompanying this was a hearty combination curry, a comforting blend of vegetables, lentils, and spices. Portions were generous, ensuring a satisfying meal, and the attentive service added to the overall enjoyable Indian dining experience.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar, located in Sao Paulo, offered a satisfying selection of ramen options. The Tonkotsu Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were the two items chosen for review. The Tonkotsu Ramen, featuring a savory broth crafted from pork bones and a generous serving of tender noodles, was a delightful treat. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, adorned with a fiery miso paste and an array of fresh vegetables, provided a potent kick of flavor. In conclusion, the Kitakata Ramen Bar presented a flavorful and satisfying ramen experience, showcasing the best of traditional Japanese cuisine in the heart of Sao Paulo.

The Better Off Bread truck in Cape Town is a sandwich lover's paradise! The Italian and Pastrami sandwiches were packed with flavor and generously filled, while the Hot Ham & Cheese was a classic comfort. The bread was fresh and the ingredients were of high quality. The bottled soda and iced tea were the perfect refreshing accompaniments. The service was efficient and friendly. This food truck is a must-visit for a delicious, satisfying meal on-the-go.

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese was a major disappointment. The standard mac and cheese was bland and undercooked, with limp noodles and sparse cheese. The lobster mac and cheese was even worse, with overcooked noodles, tough lobster, and a greasy, overpowering sauce. The only saving grace was the friendly staff and prompt delivery. Overall, I would not recommend The Mac Shack to anyone looking for a satisfying mac and cheese experience.

Tasty Tibs truck in Sydney presents an unusual Ethiopian menu, deserving exploration. Veggie Combo, a vibrant mix of well-seasoned and perfectly cooked vegetables, proved delightful. Lean Chicken Tibs, however, lacked the anticipated tenderness despite appealing spices. In contrast, Lean Beef Tibs were tender and succulent, becoming the star dish. Overall, the experience was mixed, with some dishes meeting expectations while others fell slightly short. The truck's unique concept holds promise, and with minor adjustments, it could fully deliver on its tantalizing name.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at The Mega Melt. The 'Original' grilled cheese was far from it, lacking the gooey, melted cheese one would expect. The Ranch sandwich was drowning in an excessive amount of sauce, overpowering the other ingredients. Miss Piggie, advertised as a pull-apart delight, was dry and tough. The bottled water and ice tea were the only saving graces, but they hardly justify the overall mediocre experience. For a grilled cheese truck in Boston, The Mega Melt falls short of expectations.

Sandwiches at Better Off Bread in Cape Town delivered expected flavors. Pastrami boasted a harmonious blend of spices and tender meat. Hot Ham & Cheese was satisfying with ample melted cheese over ham. While the bread was fresh, the sandwiches lacked memorable qualities. Presentation was standard, and the meal met expectations but didn't surpass them.

Cheeky Greek truck's gyro plate proves to be a delightful choice! Tender lamb, fresh pita bread, and tangy tzatziki sauce come together in perfect balance, accompanied by generous portions that leave no appetite unsated. The friendly and attentive staff contribute to a lively and inviting atmosphere, making Cheeky Greek a top recommendation for anyone seeking an authentic Greek dining experience in Cape Town.

"The Mega Melt truck in Melbourne is a must-visit for grilled cheese lovers! The Original grilled cheese sandwich was a classic delight, with the perfect blend of crispy bread and gooey cheese. Miss Piggie, with its savory pull-apart pork, added a delightful twist to the traditional grilled cheese. The Ice Tea was refreshing, making it a great companion to the sandwiches. The service was quick and friendly. Overall, a fantastic food truck experience!"

The food at this establishment was beneath expectations. The Greek salad was wilted and underdressed, and the gyro plate was greasy and flavorless. The service was also poor, with long wait times and unfriendly staff. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

A hidden gem in Seoul, the Smoky BBQ truck serves up delectable Two Meat Plates. Tender and juicy meats, seasoned and cooked to perfection, were the highlights. The BBQ sauce, a tantalizing blend of tangy and sweet, took the dish to new heights. Generous portion sizes ensured satiety, while cravings for more remained. Service was expeditious and cordial, enhancing the experience. For BBQ lovers in Seoul, Smoky BBQ is a must-visit.

"A recent visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar in Mumbai left me disappointed with their Tonkotsu Ramen. The broth lacked the rich, creamy flavor that I have come to expect from a good Tonkotsu, and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. The pork slices were tough and lacked seasoning. For the price, I expected a more authentic and satisfying ramen experience. I would not recommend this dish to fellow ramen lovers in Mumbai." A mix of freshness and authenticity, the Greek Salad from Cheeky Greek was a delight. Crisp lettuce, juicy tomatoes, and tangy olives were balanced perfectly, creating a harmonious blend of flavors. The portion size was satisfying, making it a filling meal. While the feta cheese could have been more crumbly and flavorful, the service was prompt and the packaging was secure, ensuring the salad remained fresh until consumption. Overall, a decent experience that could be improved with a few minor tweaks.

Disappointed with my order from Nani's Kitchen in Munich. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the expected richness and punch of Indian spices, making it taste dull and uninspiring. Portion size was insufficient for the price paid. Overall, not recommended if you're seeking authentic Indian flavors.

Disappointment was the theme of the day at The Plant Palace truck. The "all salads" option was far from impressive, featuring wilted lettuce and a scarcity of toppings. The "buffalo" seitan wings were a letdown, lacking the promised spice and tang. Equally unappetizing was the veggie burger, a mere overcooked slab of vegetables sandwiched in a bun. Even the ice tea and bottled soda failed to refresh, served as they were at room temperature. All in all, the experience was a profound culinary disappointment.

Better Off Bread truck's menu captivated with its simplicity and use of fresh ingredients. Italian sandwich stood out, featuring tender salami, melted cheese, and tangy giardiniera. Pastrami and Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches, with their smoky pastrami and harmonious blend of melted cheese and sweet bread, were equally delightful. Bottled water and iced tea paired perfectly with the meals. The food at Better Off Bread was bursting with flavor and skillfully prepared, making it an alluring option for a quick and fulfilling meal in Warsaw.

"Le Coin des Crêpes is a delightful find in Cape Town! The Breakfast Crepe was absolutely scrumptious, a perfect blend of sweet and savory. The crepe was light, fluffy, and cooked to perfection. The filling was generous, with fresh ingredients that added a delightful crunch and flavor. The service was prompt and friendly, making the experience even more enjoyable. Whether you're a crepe lover or just looking for a unique breakfast option, Le Coin des Crêpes is a must-visit. Highly recommended!"

"Absolutely loved my recent order from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sydney! The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen had the perfect amount of heat and the vegetables were fresh and crisp. The Tonkotsu Ramen was rich and flavorful, with tender pork and chewy noodles. And the Ice Tea was a refreshing complement to the meal. The staff were friendly and attentive, making for a great dining experience. I highly recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar for any ramen lover in Sydney!" (translated from English)

The Tasty Tibs truck in Rio de Janeiro offered a unique Ethiopian menu that was worth exploring. The Lean Beef Tibs were flavorful, with a nice balance of spices, and the meat was tender. The Veggie Combo, on the other hand, was a mix of well-cooked vegetables, providing a good contrast to the meat dish. However, the bottled water and soda were standard, as expected. The overall experience was satisfying, but not exceptional. The food was good, but it didn't quite stand out in the crowded food truck scene in Rio.

The Cheeky Greek's gyro plate and Greek salad were a satisfying treat. The gyro meat was tender and flavorful, while the salad was crisp and refreshing. The pita bread was warm and soft, and the tzatziki sauce was tangy and creamy. Overall, the meal was well-priced and enjoyable.

Mac Shack in Barcelona redefines the Mac & Cheese experience. Creamy, cheesy, and delectable descriptions characterize their Standard Mac & Cheese. Yet, the Buffalo Mac & Cheese takes center stage with its impeccable balance of spice and savory flavors, leaving a strong desire for more. This food truck catering to Mac & Cheese lovers is a must-visit due to their inventive menu and unwavering dedication to quality.

"Revenge of the Curds truly redefines the poutine experience in Cape Town. The 'Mother's Favorite' was a delightful blend of rich flavors, while 'The Kitchen Sink' offered an exciting variety of toppings that made every bite a surprise. The 'Classic' was a perfect homage to the traditional poutine, executed flawlessly. The quality of ingredients was top-notch, and the service was exceptional. This food truck is a must-visit for poutine lovers!"

"Peking Truck w Warszawie to świetna opcja dla fanów kuchni chińskiej! Zamówiłam Wonton Soup oraz Combo Fried Rice i oba dania były niesamowite. Wontony były pyszne i pełne smaku, a zestaw ryżu w stylu chińskim idealnie urozmaicony i obfity. Polecam serdecznie Peking Truck wszystkim, którzy szukają autentycznych i smacznych dań chińskich w Warszawie. Dziękuję za zawołanie i polecam dalej!"

The Mega Melt's "Original" and "Ranch" grilled cheese sandwich was an absolute delight. The bread was perfectly toasted, and the cheese was melted just right, oozing out of the sandwich with every bite. The ingredients were fresh and flavorful, and the overall flavor of the sandwich was simply mouthwatering. I highly recommend this sandwich to anyone who loves a good grilled cheese.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" w Krakowie to niezaprzeczalnie jedno z najlepszych miejsc, gdzie można skosztować autentycznych, smacznych hot-dogów. Moja ostatnia zapytka obejmowała lodową herbatę oraz trzy klasyczne sausages: New York Dog, Chicago Dog i Coney Dog. Każdy z nich był wykonany z ręki i z dużą dbałością o szczegóły. Herbata była świeża i przyprawiona idealnie. Hot-dogi były pyszne, aromatyczne i prawie jak w oryginale. Polecam wszystkim, którzy chcą spróbować autentycznych hot-dogów w Krakowie!Translation: "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Krakow is undoubtedly one of the best places to taste authentic and delicious hot dogs. My last order included iced tea and three classic sausages: New York Dog, Chicago Dog and Coney Dog. Each of them was made by hand and with great attention to detail. The iced tea was fresh and perfectly spiced. The hot dogs were delicious, aromatic and almost like the original. I recommend it to everyone who wants to try authentic hot dogs in Krakow!

Le Coin des Crêpes is a culinary delight nestled in Montreal, offering an exquisite array of crepes that tantalize your taste buds. The Breakfast Crepe was a perfect blend of savory and sweet, while the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a unique twist on a classic comfort food. The star of the show, however, was the Crepe Suzette, a divine dessert crepe that left us craving for more. The beverages, including Bottled Water, Bottled Soda, and Ice Tea, were a refreshing complement to our meal. The overall experience was exceptional, and we highly recommend Le Coin des Crêpes to anyone seeking a delightful crepe experience.

Tasty Tibs truck in Seoul showcased a savory Ethiopian meal. Veggie combo and lean chicken tibs boasted delightful spicing, boasting tender vegetables and juicy chicken. Injera, the traditional Ethiopian flatbread, accompanied the tibs with its fluffy texture. A bottled water provided a refreshing contrast. The ambiance was laid-back and amiable, and the service proved prompt. For those craving authentic Ethiopian cuisine in Seoul's core, Tasty Tibs is a must-try.

The Tasty Tibs restaurant in Seoul delivered an exceptional dining experience. The menu showcased the vibrant Ethiopian flavors, offering an array of tantalizing dishes. The lean chicken and beef tibs were tender and flavorful, perfectly complementing the authentic Ethiopian spices. The veggie combo provided a generous portion of fresh and crispy vegetables, enhancing the overall flavor profile. The bottled water and ice tea were refreshing and quenching, while the bottled soda added a touch of sweetness. The service was attentive and prompt, ensuring a pleasant and memorable meal. Overall, the Tasty Tibs experience was a testament to the vibrant culinary heritage of Ethiopia and a must-try for any foodie visiting Seoul.

The "Better Off Bread" truck in Seoul provides a fair selection of sandwich offerings. Their Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich arrived heated to an acceptable level, with a harmonious blend of cheese and ham. The Pastrami sandwich boasted a generous quantity of meat. As for the Italian sandwich, it delivered robust flavors, but could have used a tad more dressing. The Bottled Water and Ice Tea were unremarkable, meeting standard expectations. To summarize, the meal was satisfactory, but lacked any significant wow factor. Expanding the menu to include unique options could assist the truck in distinguishing itself in the highly competitive sandwich market.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine at the Madrid location was a satisfying treat. The crispy curds, tender beef, and creamy gravy were all perfectly balanced, making for a comforting and flavorful dish. The portion size was generous, and the service was friendly. While the poutine may not be the most authentic Canadian version, it's a solid option for those seeking a taste of the north in Spain.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Madrid failed to impress with its Three Meat Plate. The meat was overcooked, tough, and lacked the smoky flavor promised by the truck's name. The sides were bland and uninspiring, not providing the necessary balance to the dish. The overall experience was disappointing, especially considering the hype around this BBQ truck. I expected a lot more from a place that prides itself on its BBQ. Unfortunately, Smoky BBQ didn't deliver on its promises.

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese offerings were a severe let-down. The lobster mac and cheese was dominated by the overwhelming presence of processed cheese and lacked the finesse of genuine lobster. The buffalo mac and cheese suffered from a similar issue, with the fiery sauce masking the subtle flavor of the chicken. The standard mac and cheese, devoid of any embellishments, was the only saving grace, but ultimately, it failed to impress. The overall experience was marred by the excessive use of processed cheese and the lack of fresh, flavorful ingredients.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Seoul served up a mix of items from their Gyros menu. The Greek Salad was fresh and crisp, a good balance to the hearty King Combo and Gyro Plate. The bottled water and soda were standard. Overall, the food was satisfying, but not particularly memorable. The portions were generous, ensuring a filling meal. The service was efficient, making for a smooth ordering and pick-up process.

The Mac Shack in Barcelona is an absolute delight for mac & cheese lovers! Their menu offers a variety of unique and delicious options, leaving you spoiled for choice. The Standard Mac & Cheese was creamy and satisfying, while the Buffalo Mac & Cheese added a spicy kick that made it excitingly different. But the true star of the show was the Lobster Mac & Cheese—its rich, indulgent flavors created the perfect symphony of taste. Overall, a fantastic culinary experience that I highly recommend!

A must-visit for ramen enthusiasts, Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sydney offers an extensive menu of classic ramen choices. Creamy chicken ramen, spicy miso vegetable ramen, and tonkotsu ramen are among the options. Each bowl showcases fresh ingredients and harmonizes flavor and texture. Rich and savory broth, al dente noodles, and abundant toppings ensure an authentic and satisfying experience. Accompany your ramen with refreshing bottled water. Highly recommended for those seeking an authentic ramen adventure.

A delightful experience awaits at Guac n' Roll truck with its exceptional tacos. The three-taco combo plate is an ideal choice for savoring the diverse and delectable flavors. The fish burrito, filled with fresh, succulent seafood, is a standout for seafood enthusiasts. Ingredients are top-notch, and portions generously satisfy. Love infuses every bite of the tacos. Friendly staff and swift service complete the authentic Mexican food adventure. For a savory and true-to-form Mexican food encounter, Guac n' Roll is your destination.

The Kitchen Sink at "Revenge of the Curds" in Melbourne offered a unique twist on classic comfort food with their poutine menu, featuring fresh, crispy curds and savory gravy. The refreshing ice tea paired perfectly with the rich poutine, and the friendly and inviting atmosphere made for a memorable dining experience. Prompt and efficient service sealed the deal, leaving me highly satisfied and eager to recommend The Kitchen Sink to anyone seeking a hearty, flavorful meal.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Nani's Kitchen. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala lacked the rich, aromatic spices one expects from Indian cuisine, resulting in a bland, forgettable dish. The Tandoori Mixed Grill, while visually appealing, was overcooked and dry, leaving much to be desired in terms of texture and flavor. The Combination Curry was a mix of confusion, with flavors clashing rather than complementing each other. Even the Bottled Water failed to quench my thirst for a satisfying dining experience. Overall, Nani's Kitchen served up a meal that was far from the culinary journey I had anticipated.

The Peking Truck's Combo Lo Mein was a disappointing experience. The noodles were overcooked and lacked the expected flavor, while the vegetables were undercooked and crunchy. The promised combination of chicken, shrimp, and beef was also unbalanced, with an overwhelming amount of chicken and barely any shrimp or beef. The portion size was smaller than expected for the price. Overall, not a satisfying meal for a Chinese food lover in Sydney.

The Le Coin des Crêpes truck in Delhi is a must-try for crepe lovers. I ordered the Suzette crepe, which was absolutely divine. The crepe was perfectly thin and crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside, with a generous spread of fresh fruit and whipped cream. The fruit was ripe and flavorful, and the whipped cream was smooth and creamy. Overall, I had a very positive experience with Le Coin des Crêpes. The crepe was delicious, and the service was friendly. I would highly recommend this truck to anyone who is looking for a quick and satisfying treat.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine offered at the Montreal location was a culinary disaster. The fries were limp and undercooked, the curds were dry and rubbery, and the gravy was bland and watery. The bottled soda, "The Classic," was the only redeeming aspect of the meal. The kitchen sink item, presumably a joke, was not a laughing matter. The entire order was a far cry from the mouthwatering poutine I had hoped for.

"Revenge of the Curds' 'The Classic' poutine in Warsaw delivers just what you'd expect from a traditional poutine dish. The fries were crispy, the cheese curds were fresh and squeaky, and the gravy was rich and flavorful. However, the portion size was a bit smaller than anticipated. The presentation was simple, yet appealing. Overall, it's a solid choice for poutine lovers, but it might not completely satisfy those with a larger appetite."

The food at Smoky BBQ was simply not impressive. The pulled pork sandwich was dry and flavorless, and the three-meat plate was overcooked and greasy. The spring mix salad was limp and uninspired. The only saving grace was the ice tea, which was refreshing. The service was also poor, with long wait times and staff who were not attentive. Overall, I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

The Mega Melt's "Miss Piggie" grilled cheese sandwich is a true delight. The bread is perfectly toasted, the cheese oozes with gooey goodness, and the fillings are fresh and flavorful. The perfect combination of crispy bread, melted cheese, and savory fillings make this sandwich a winner. The friendly staff at the Madrid location are always eager to provide excellent service, and the atmosphere is warm and inviting. Overall, the Miss Piggie is a must-try for any grilled cheese enthusiast.

Order summary: A meal at Nani's Kitchen in Vancouver consisted of bottled water and a combination curry. The bottled water was satisfactory. The combination curry, however, was the meal's standout. Its flavors were rich and aromatic, boasting a harmonious blend of spices. Ingredients were fresh and abundant in the generous portion size. Service was both friendly and attentive, contributing to an enjoyable dining experience. The food at Nani's Kitchen was undeniably delicious.

A New York City food truck offers a must-try poutine experience, "Revenge of the Curds". The Classic poutine features crispy curds, creamy gravy, and melt-in-your-mouth cheese, providing a satisfying comfort food indulgence. For those seeking a more adventurous option, the Kitchen Sink poutine with smoked pork and bacon is sure to impress. The bottled water and soda options complement the meal perfectly. The friendly service and inviting atmosphere make this truck a hidden gem in the city. Overall, this poutine experience is highly recommended for anyone visiting New York City.

A must-try for poutine enthusiasts is Cape Town's Kitchen Sink. Its menu showcases the celebrated "Mothers Favorite," a bountiful serving of crispy fries, fresh cheese curds, and savory gravy. The curds' texture is ideal, boasting a perfect chewiness, while the gravy is abundant in rich, savory flavor. The Kitchen Sink provides a varied assortment of bottled sodas to enhance your poutine experience. The establishment is an excellent destination to indulge in your poutine cravings and savor local tastes.

Better Off Bread truck is a top recommendation for Cape Town food enthusiasts. Their Hot Ham & Cheese and Italian sandwiches are nothing short of delectable. The bread is always fresh and fluffy, while the fillings are abundant and bursting with flavor. The Italian sandwich, in particular, is a standout with its fresh mozzarella, salami, and roasted vegetables. The Hot Ham & Cheese is a satisfying classic, with its melted cheese and soft bread. Additionally, the friendly service and prompt delivery are much appreciated. In conclusion, Better Off Bread is highly recommended for those seeking a tasty and convenient sandwich experience in Cape Town.

The Chicago Dog from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck is a must-try. Its bun is soft, while the meat is grilled to perfection. The toppings are fresh and full of flavor, staying true to the classic Chicago Dog recipe. The staff is welcoming and quick, ensuring a speedy service. For those seeking a tasty hot dog in Stockholm, this food truck is highly recommended.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Munich lived up to its name, delivering flavorful Ethiopian fare and refreshing iced tea. The lean chicken and beef tibs were tender and savory, perfectly complementing the fluffy injera bread. The veggie combo provided a satisfying mix of fresh vegetables and spiced lentils. The bottled water quenched my thirst, and the overall atmosphere was friendly and inviting. I highly recommend checking out Tasty Tibs if you're looking for a taste of Ethiopia in the heart of Munich.

"Le Coin des Crêpes is a delightful find in Delhi! The Breakfast Crepe was a perfect start to the day, filled with fresh ingredients and a delightful blend of flavors. The Ice Tea was refreshing, a great companion to the meal. But the star of the show was the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe. It was an unexpected fusion that worked wonderfully, offering a unique twist to traditional crepes. The service was prompt and the staff was friendly. Overall, a fantastic dining experience that I highly recommend!"

Seitan Buffalo Wings from Plant Palace in Warsaw presented a distinctive culinary adventure. Texture of the Seitan Buffalo Wings bore an unexpected resemblance to actual chicken wings. Buffalo sauce coating the seitan delivered a desirable level of heat. Yet, the dish could have profited from a more equitable flavor composition, as the sauce exhibitied a dominant presence. Portion size was ample given the cost. For vegetarians yearning for a carnivorous sensation, this alternative warranted consideration; nonetheless, it might not completely please those seeking a more refined taste experience.

"Guac n' Roll" truck is a bombastic addition to Mumbai's street food scene! Their Tacos menu is a delight, and I can vouch for the deliciousness of their Three Taco Combo Plate and Veggie Taco Bowl. The freshness and quality of ingredients used were top-notch, and the flavors were perfectly balanced. To quench my thirst, I ordered a Bottled Water, Bottled Soda, and Ice Tea, all of which were refreshing and hit the spot. And let me tell you, their Chicken Burrito and Lean Burrito Bowl were simply divine! The portions were generous, and the prices were reasonable, making it an excellent value for money. The Guac n' Roll team was friendly, attentive, and made sure I had a great dining experience. I highly recommend Guac n' Roll to all you taco and burrito lovers out there! Aap sabe ko Guac n' Roll ke taco aur burrito ke maza bhi try karna chahiye!

The Smoky BBQ's Pulled Pork Sandwich was a disappointment. The pork lacked the expected smoky flavor and was dry, making the sandwich overall quite bland. The coleslaw, which should have added a refreshing crunch, was drowned in an overly sweet dressing. The bun was the only decent component, but it couldn't save the dish. For a BBQ restaurant in Seoul, I expected more. Unfortunately, this sandwich didn't deliver the quality or taste I was hoping for.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Berlin. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was far from creamy, with a watery broth that lacked depth and flavor. The chicken was overcooked and tough, making it difficult to enjoy the dish. To add to the disappointment, the Ice Tea was overly sweet, masking any potential refreshing qualities. Overall, a meal that failed to deliver on expectations.

"Le Coin des Crêpes in Barcelona served up a Breakfast Crepe that met expectations. The crepe itself was well-executed, boasting a filling that harmoniously combined egg, ham, and cheese. Its texture struck a pleasant middle ground, avoiding the extremes of excessive crispiness or sogginess. Yet, the flavor failed to truly distinguish itself. The service was swift and efficient, contributing to an overall satisfactory dining experience. However, the lack of a standout element may not compel a return visit."

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Madrid offered a satisfying poutine experience. The "Kitchen Sink" was a generous portion, loaded with a variety of toppings that added a unique twist to the traditional dish. The "Classic" was a solid choice, delivering the expected flavors of authentic poutine. The bottled soda was a refreshing accompaniment. However, the wait time was a bit longer than anticipated. Overall, the food quality made up for the delay, but improvements in service speed would enhance the dining experience.

Guac n' Roll truck's tacos and burritos are an absolute delight. Crispy tortillas, fresh ingredients, and flavorful toppings make for a satisfying meal that's perfect for any occasion. The chicken burrito, fish burrito, and taco combo plate were all delicious and generously portioned. Friendly service and quick turnaround time add to the overall positive experience. If you're craving authentic Mexican food in Hamburg, Guac n' Roll is highly recommended.

"Le Coin des Crêpes truly delivered an exceptional experience! The Breakfast Crepe was absolute perfection, with a delightful blend of flavors that made my morning brighter. The crepe was fresh, well-prepared, and served at the perfect temperature. It's clear that they use high-quality ingredients. Paired with the Bottled Water, it was a refreshing and satisfying meal. Their service in London was prompt and efficient, making the entire experience a delight. I highly recommend Le Coin des Crêpes for anyone seeking a delicious, authentic crepe experience."

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The Tonkotsu Ramen lacked depth and richness, a far cry from the authentic, robust flavor one expects. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was bland, with a spice level that barely registered. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was a miss, with an overly thick, gluey broth. The drinks, bottled water and soda, were the only items that met expectations. Overall, a disappointing ramen experience in Sao Paulo.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Freezing Point in Rio de Janeiro. The Ice Cream Sandwich, far from being a delight, was a letdown. The ice cream was not as creamy as expected, and the cookies were soggy, lacking the necessary crunch. The Lemonade, too, was underwhelming, lacking the refreshing tanginess one anticipates. The overall experience was below par, failing to meet the expectations set by the promising menu. A revisit seems unlikely unless significant improvements are made.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Boston is a must-visit for any ramen enthusiast. The creamy chicken ramen, spicy miso vegetable ramen, and tonkotsu ramen are all expertly crafted, using fresh ingredients and traditional techniques. The broth is rich and flavorful, the noodles are perfectly cooked, and the toppings are fresh and creative. Every bowl is a testament to the chef's passion and dedication, and the atmosphere is warm and inviting. If you're looking for the best ramen in Boston, look no further than Kitakata Ramen Bar.

The "Guac n' Roll" truck in Seattle is a hidden gem! The Veggie Taco Bowl and Lean Burrito Bowl were absolutely delicious, bursting with fresh flavors and a perfect blend of spices. The veggies were crisp and the guacamole was creamy and rich. The bottled water was a refreshing complement to the meal. The quality of the food, coupled with the friendly service, makes this truck a must-visit. I'm already craving my next meal from Guac n' Roll!

Kitakata Ramen Bar in London surpassed all anticipations with their exceptional ramen selections. A symphony of tastes, the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen expertly harmonized the fiery spices with the umami-rich miso foundation. Equally noteworthy was the Tonkotsu Ramen, boasting a luxurious and velvety pork broth that offered both solace and gratification. The noodles in each dish were prepared flawlessly, their pleasing texture enhancing the robust accompaniments. The overall culinary journey was remarkable, making this ramen bar a must-visit for anyone in pursuit of a genuine and scrumptious ramen adventure in London.

The Cheeky Greek truck's gyros are a must-try for any foodie visiting Toronto. The gyro plate, featuring tender lamb, fresh toppings, and fluffy pita bread, is a classic choice. The King Combo, which includes a gyros sandwich, a chicken souvlaki, and a side of fries, is a hearty feast for the whole family. The bottled soda selection is extensive, offering a range of refreshing options to accompany your meal. Overall, the Cheeky Greek truck offers a flavorful and satisfying gyros experience in the heart of Toronto.

A gyro order of The King Combo from Cheeky Greek in Denver delivered satisfyingly flavorful and tender meat, enhanced by the added refreshing taste of tzatziki sauce. But the pita bread fell short, being drier than optimal, slightly diminishing the experience. Despite this, the generous portion size warranted a fair value for the given price. However, improvements could be made, most notably with the pita bread.

Grilled cheese enthusiasts in Denver will delight in The Mega Melt's truck and its offering, "The Mega Melt." My beverage of choice was "The Original" ice tea, which provided a cooling respite. For my sandwich, I selected "Miss Piggie." The tea was invigorating, while the sandwich demonstrated balanced textures, with crispy exterior bread contrasting the soft interior. The cheese was impeccably melted, enhancing the mouthwatering experience. The sandwich's inclusion of ranch dressing introduced a robust flavor, although it proved a touch excessive for my preferences. Despite this, I admire the culinary creativity that yields an intriguing and appetizing sandwich. I wholeheartedly suggest The Mega Melt for those seeking a delectable and expedient meal.

A distinct crepe encounter was had at Le Coin des Crêpes. The Breakfast Crepe brought satisfaction with its harmonious combination of fresh elements. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe introduced a captivating take on a traditional dish. The Crepe Suzette stole the limelight, delivering a scintillating burst of citrus flavors. The food truck's Hamburg positioning proved convenient. Service was neither outstanding nor subpar, with crepes arriving as anticipated. Le Coin des Crêpes caters well to those desiring diverse crepe selections.

The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe and Crepe Suzette from Le Coin des Crêpes in Montreal presented a unique twist on traditional crepes. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe offered a savory experience, with its filling adequately mirroring the classic dish. However, the Crepe Suzette, an iconic dessert crepe, was slightly underwhelming, lacking the expected zest. Overall, the meal provided a satisfactory exploration of both sweet and savory crepe options, making it a decent choice for those seeking variety.

The Mac Shack's offerings were far from satisfying. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked the creaminess one would expect, and the Buffalo Mac & Cheese was overwhelmingly spicy, overshadowing any other flavors. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, the most anticipated dish, was disappointingly bland and skimpy on lobster. The bottled water and soda were the only items that met expectations. Overall, a disappointing experience for a Mac & Cheese lover in Barcelona.

A feast for both the eyes and the stomach, the gyro plate at Cheeky Greek is a delicious delight. Generous portions of tender lamb, fresh vegetables, and fluffy pita bread are wrapped in a warm and flavorful sauce. The meat is succulent and perfectly seasoned, while the vegetables are crisp and fresh. The pita bread is soft and pliable, and the overall presentation is very impressive. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a satisfying and flavorful Greek meal.

The Peking Truck in Cape Town is a hidden gem serving up delicious Chinese cuisine. The Combo Fried Rice was flavorful, with each ingredient perfectly cooked and well-seasoned. The Wonton Soup was a delightful accompaniment, with tender wontons and a savory broth that warmed the soul. The bottled water was a refreshing way to cleanse the palate between bites. The quality of the food, combined with the friendly service, made for an exceptional dining experience. I highly recommend the Peking Truck for anyone craving authentic Chinese food in Cape Town.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my "The Ranch, Miss Piggie" order from The Mega Melt in Madrid. The grilled cheese, which should have been the star, was lackluster and underwhelming. The bread was soggy, not crispy as expected, and the cheese was barely melted. The ranch flavor was also absent, making the sandwich bland and uninteresting. The Miss Piggie, which I had high hopes for, was equally disappointing. The bacon was chewy, not crispy, and the overall taste was mediocre. Unfortunately, this meal did not live up to the hype of a grilled cheese truck.

A culinary journey was had with the Cheeky Greek truck's menu. The King Combo, an impressive display of the establishment's namesake, featured a gyros sandwich with ample gyros, housed in a warm pita bread, and adorned with fresh toppings and tangy tzatziki sauce. The Greek Salad, a crisp and cooling addition to any gyros or falafel, consisted of lettuce, tomatoes, onions, and cucumbers. The Ice Tea, a thirst-quenching companion to the spicy gyros and falafel, offered refreshing sweetness. The Cheeky Greek truck's food and beverages delivered a flavorful and satisfying experience for local food enthusiasts.

The crepe Suzette and chicken pot pie crepe from Le Coin des Crêpes in Sao Paulo were a major disappointment. The crepe was dry and rubbery, and the filling was bland and uninspired. The chicken pot pie crepe was even worse, with a tough pastry and a filling that tasted like it had been sitting out for hours. Overall, I would not recommend Le Coin des Crêpes to anyone.

A wide range of ramen options are offered at Kitakata Ramen Bar, located in the heart of Sydney. The menu includes classic tonkotsu ramen, creamy chicken ramen, and spicy miso vegetable ramen.The tonkotsu broth is rich and flavorful, while the creamy chicken ramen is smooth and satisfying. For those who prefer a kick of heat, the spicy miso vegetable ramen is a great choice.Overall, the ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar is some of the best in Sydney.

The Plant Palace veggie burger was an absolute delight! The patty was perfectly cooked, the vegetables were fresh and crisp, and the overall flavor was simply mouthwatering. The bun was soft and fluffy, and the toppings were just right. I especially loved the avocado and the tomato. The service was friendly and efficient, and the atmosphere was relaxed and inviting. I highly recommend this burger to anyone who is looking for a healthy and delicious meal.

"Experienced Revenge of the Curds in New York City, sampling The Classic and Mother's Favorite from their poutine menu. The Classic was a solid take on the traditional dish, while Mother's Favorite offered an interesting twist with its unique combination of toppings. The bottled water, soda, and ice tea were standard fare. Overall, the meal was satisfying, though it didn't particularly stand out in the crowded field of food truck options."

Freezing Point, an ice cream truck in Rio de Janeiro, served up a Waffle Cone, Popsicle, and Ice Tea. The Waffle Cone was crisp and fresh, providing a satisfying crunch with every bite. The Popsicle, on the other hand, was a refreshing treat, perfect for a hot summer day. However, the Ice Tea was a bit underwhelming, lacking the expected flavor and sweetness. Overall, the experience was decent, with the ice cream offerings being the clear standouts.

The mango flavor was refreshing and vibrant, complementing the sweetness of the rice perfectly. The overall texture of the dish was smooth and satisfying, making it a perfect treat to cool down on a hot day.

Smoky BBQ Truck in Madrid Delivers Solid ExperienceA recent visit to the Smoky BBQ truck in Madrid resulted in a satisfying barbecue experience. The Ice Tea served was refreshing and an excellent accompaniment to the meal. The Rack of Pork Ribs was tender and well-seasoned, though it could have benefited from a touch more smoke flavor.The Two Meat Plate provided a good variety, with both meats cooked to the correct tenderness. Generous portion sizes ensured a filling and satisfying meal. While the food was enjoyable, it didn't distinguish itself from other BBQ options in the area. However, it's still a decent choice for BBQ lovers in Madrid.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Tokyo failed to deliver the expected Greek culinary experience. The Greek Salad was disappointingly bland, lacking the freshness and tanginess one would anticipate. The King Combo, which should have been the star of the show, was underwhelming. The gyro meat was dry, and the pita was soggy, making the entire experience quite forgettable. The menu type promised much more than what was delivered. Overall, a disappointing meal that didn't live up to the hype of a Greek feast.

The Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck was an absolute delight to find in Tokyo. The New York Dog and Coney Dog were both perfectly executed, with fresh toppings and a friendly atmosphere. The hot dogs were juicy and flavorful, and the toppings were fresh and creative. The owner was passionate and welcoming, and the prices were reasonable. Overall, I highly recommend checking out this truck if you're in Tokyo.

A memorable dining experience was had with Nani's Kitchen's Lean Chicken Tikka Masala in Delhi. The chicken, tender and well-cooked, was enveloped in a flavorful tikka masala that struck a perfect balance between creamy and tangy. The spices delivered a delightful kick, while the aroma created an inviting atmosphere. The accompanying naan was soft and fluffy, and the basmati rice was cooked to perfection. This dish was a standout example of Indian cuisine, highly recommended for anyone visiting Delhi.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crêpes. The Crepe Suzette lacked the expected zest, tasting more like a pancake than a delicate French crepe. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a confusing blend of flavors, failing to deliver the comforting taste of a traditional pot pie. The Breakfast Crepe was average at best, not living up to the hype. The bottled soda and water were the only items that met expectations, but that's not saying much. Overall, this truck didn't deliver the authentic crepe experience I was hoping for in Sao Paulo.

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Mumbai. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked and dry, lacking the juiciness and flavor expected from a quality grill. The Combination Curry was also underwhelming, with a watery consistency and a bland taste that failed to capture the richness of Indian spices. Overall, the meal was a letdown and did not meet the standards one would anticipate from an Indian cuisine restaurant. I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking authentic, flavorful Indian food.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Hamburg delivered an exceptional dining experience. I ordered a chicken burrito, a two taco combo plate, and a bottled soda. The food was fresh, flavorful, and well-portioned. The chicken in the burrito was juicy and tender, and the taco fillings were perfectly balanced. The salsa and guacamole were smooth and creamy, enhancing the overall flavor of the meal. The staff were friendly and efficient, ensuring a quick and enjoyable service. Overall, I highly recommend Guac n' Roll for anyone seeking a mouth-watering taco experience in Hamburg.

The "Smoky BBQ" in Stockholm failed to impress. The Rack of Pork Ribs was overcooked, resulting in a dry and chewy texture. The Spring Mix Salad was drowned in dressing, overwhelming the freshness of the greens. The Pulled Pork Sandwich lacked flavor, and the meat was not as tender as expected. The Ice Tea was watered down, and the Three Meat Plate was unremarkable. The only positive was the Bottled Water, which is not saying much. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to BBQ standards.

The "Revenge of the Curds" truck in Melbourne served up a decent poutine experience. The "Mother's Favorite" was a solid choice, offering a good balance of flavors, while "The Classic" was just as its name suggests - a traditional poutine that hit the spot. The bottled water was a welcome addition to balance out the richness of the meal. However, there was nothing particularly outstanding about the dishes. They were well-prepared and satisfying, but didn't necessarily stand out from other poutine offerings in the city. Overall, a reliable choice for those craving poutine.

The Mac Shack's "Lobster Mac & Cheese" was a culinary disaster. The mac and cheese was dry and powdery, lacking the creamy smoothness one expects. The lobster was overcooked and rubbery, detracting from the dish's overall flavor. The bottled water was tepid and un refreshing. Overall, an unappetizing and overpriced experience.

A delightful treat was the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe at Le Coin des Crêpes in Sao Paulo. The crepe boasted a fluffy texture and a golden brown exterior, boasting a crispy exterior and a soft, chewy interior. The savory and flavorful filling showcased tender chicken, vegetables, and a rich gravy. The meal's indulgence came from the harmonious blend of the flaky crepe and the hearty filling. Despite the steep price, the superior quality of the ingredients and the overall experience justified the splurge. A highly recommended crepe destination for Sao Paulo visitors.

The food from Nani's Kitchen was a mix of highs and lows. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was flavorful and tender, living up to the reputation of Delhi's Indian cuisine. However, the Combination Curry fell short of expectations, lacking the depth of spices one would anticipate. The Bottled Soda was a refreshing accompaniment, but it didn't particularly stand out. Overall, the experience was average, with some dishes hitting the mark and others missing it.

"Guac n' Roll truly delivers a fiesta of flavors! I was absolutely thrilled with my order. The Three Taco Combo Plate was a delightful medley of tastes, each taco uniquely delectable. The Chicken Burrito was generously filled, perfectly balancing the tender chicken with fresh veggies and their signature guacamole. But the showstopper was the Fish Burrito - crispy, flavorful, and simply divine! Cape Town's food scene is certainly enriched by this fantastic taco truck. A must-visit for all taco enthusiasts!"

A delightful blend of savory and comfort, the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe at Le Coin des Crêpes was a culinary masterpiece. The Crepe Suzette, with its tangy, sweet flavors, was a delight to the taste buds. The Breakfast Crepe, filled with fresh, high-quality ingredients, was the perfect start to the day. The crepes were cooked to perfection, with a delicate crispness that complemented the rich fillings. The service was prompt and friendly, adding to the overall enjoyable dining experience. Le Coin des Crêpes is a must-visit in Cape Town for crepe enthusiasts.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Delhi offered a satisfactory dining experience. The Greek Salad was fresh and flavorful, with a good balance of ingredients. The Gyro Plate, however, was a bit underwhelming. The meat was adequately seasoned, but the pita bread was slightly dry. The Bottled Soda was a standard accompaniment. Overall, the meal was decent, but there's room for improvement, particularly with the Gyro Plate.

The "Better Off Bread" truck in Seoul failed to deliver on its promise. The Pastrami sandwich was disappointingly dry, lacking the juicy, flavorful meat I was expecting. The accompanying Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were average at best, not adding any value to the meal. The Italian sandwich, which should have been a highlight, was also underwhelming. The bread was soggy and the fillings were uninspiring. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype.

"Nani's Kitchen truly delivers an authentic Indian culinary experience! The Tandoori Mixed Grill was a delight, perfectly cooked and bursting with flavor. The Combination Curry was equally impressive, offering a rich blend of spices that was both comforting and exciting. Even the Bottled Water was refreshing, a testament to their attention to detail. If you're in Mumbai and craving genuine Indian cuisine, Nani's Kitchen is a must-visit!"

Nani's Kitchen in Mumbai offers a delightful Combination Curry, blending classic Indian tastes. This curry boasts a velvety, rich consistency and a spice level that is harmoniously balanced, neither too strong nor too mild. The assortment of vegetables and paneer in the curry lends a pleasant crunch and hearty feel to the dish. Unfortunately, the portion size was smaller than anticipated. In summary, the experience was pleasurable but could have been enhanced with a larger serving.

A delightful experience was had with Peking Truck's wonton soup. The broth exhibited rich flavors and savory undertones. Wontons were expertly prepared, with steaming ensuring their perfection and fillings bursting with juicy pork. Authentic ingredients graced each bowl, and portions were ample. This dish is a must-try for those seeking an authentic taste of Chinese cuisine in Berlin.

Le Coin des Crêpes is a culinary delight nestled in Berlin, serving up a delectable array of crepes that are nothing short of extraordinary. The Ice Tea was refreshing, the perfect accompaniment to the Crepe Suzette, which was a delightful blend of sweet and tangy flavors. The Breakfast Crepe was a hearty start to the day, filled with fresh ingredients that danced on the taste buds. But the star of the show was the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe, a unique twist on a classic dish that was both comforting and innovative. The service was prompt, the atmosphere was charming, and the overall experience was one that I would highly recommend to anyone seeking a memorable dining experience.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in London is a must-visit for any ramen enthusiast. The menu features a wide range of mouth-watering ramen options, including the creamy chicken ramen, spicy miso vegetable ramen, and tonkotsu ramen. Each bowl is made with fresh ingredients and a generous serving of flavorful broth. The ice tea is also a refreshing accompaniment to the ramen. The atmosphere is casual and inviting, and the service is friendly and efficient. Overall, I highly recommend Kitakata Ramen Bar for a delicious and authentic ramen experience.

A delightful treat, the Italian sandwich at Better Off Bread in London was. Fresh and crispy bread, flavorful and well-proportioned fillings, and high-quality ingredients, all in one. Well-balanced and satisfying, the sandwich was, despite the steep price. Worth the splurge, it was, due to the quality of the ingredients and the overall experience.

A delectable array of crepes graces the Le Coin des Crêpes menu, each one skillfully made with fresh and savory ingredients. I chose the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe, an enjoyable selection. The soft crepe beautifully encased the savory filling, consisting of succulent chicken, airy puff pastry, and an enticing blend of vegetables. The Crepe Suzette, a classic duo of sweet crepe and succulent fruit, was equally captivating. The fruit exhibited ripe sweetness, harmoniously complementing the delicate crepe. The overall experience at Le Coin des Crêpes was remarkable, delivering a taste of French artistry and indulgence in the core of Cape Town.

The Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in London was as expected. The broth was rich and creamy, the noodles had a nice bite, and the toppings were fresh. However, it didn't particularly stand out among other ramen places in the city. The portion size was satisfactory, and the service was efficient. Overall, it was a decent dining experience, but not one that necessarily warrants a repeat visit.

A visit to Guac n' Roll truck in Denver is essential for taco connoisseurs. The Two Taco Combo Plate was a delight with its juicy, well-seasoned ground beef and fresh toppings. Both the Chicken Burrito and Fish Burrito were impressive, showcasing tender chicken and flaky fish. Each bite offered an irresistible taste sensation, sparking a desire for more. The ample portions and cordial service make this an excellent choice for a filling and gratifying meal on the move. I strongly suggest exploring Guac n' Roll if you're seeking Denver's finest tacos.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truly lives up to its name! I recently had the pleasure of trying their Chicago Dog and Coney Dog in Vancouver, and I was blown away by the fantastic flavors. The Chicago Dog, with its perfect blend of toppings, offered a delightful burst of taste in every bite. The Coney Dog, on the other hand, was a classic delight, cooked to perfection. The hot dogs were juicy and flavorful, and the buns were soft and fresh. The service was quick and friendly, making the experience even better. If you're a hot dog lover, this is a must-try. Not the Wurst Hot Dogs has certainly earned a spot on my list of favorite food trucks!"

Disappointment was the main course with my order from The Mega Melt in Tokyo. The Ranch sandwich lacked flavor and the cheese was barely melted. Miss Piggie, supposedly their signature dish, was overly greasy and the bread was soggy. The bottled soda and water were the only saving graces, but that's not saying much. I expected more from a highly-rated grilled cheese truck. Unfortunately, The Mega Melt did not live up to its name or reputation.

The gyro plate at Cheeky Greek in Tokyo was a satisfying treat. The tender lamb was perfectly seasoned, and the tzatziki sauce was tangy and creamy. The fluffy pita bread was warm and fresh, and the overall portion was generous. While the service was friendly, the wait time was a bit long. Overall, I would recommend the gyro plate at Cheeky Greek for anyone looking for a delicious and authentic Greek experience in the heart of Tokyo.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Tokyo delivered a satisfactory meal. The Three Meat Plate was well-cooked, with each meat offering a distinct flavor. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was tender and juicy, although it could have used a bit more sauce. The Spring Mix Salad was fresh and a nice balance to the heavier BBQ items. The Bottled Water was standard. Overall, it was a decent dining experience, but there's room for improvement in terms of flavor balance.

Mac Shack's Paris menu presented an array of Mac & Cheese dishes to a welcoming audience, yet minor inconsistencies surfaced. The Standard, Buffalo, and Lobster Mac & Cheese variants delivered rich flavors and left diners content. However, the Lobster Mac & Cheese's lobster addition seemed out of place. Bottled water and soda options sufficed, while the iced tea offered a delightful respite. The culinary experience and beverages combined for a fulfilling meal, though the Lobster Mac & Cheese's lobster inclusion merits reevaluation.

The Guac n' Roll truck's Lean Burrito Bowl was an absolute delight. The tender chicken, fresh guacamole, crispy tortilla, and tangy sauce combined perfectly to create a flavor explosion. The generous portion was large enough to satisfy my appetite, and the friendly staff were quick to provide excellent service. I highly recommend this taco truck for anyone looking for a delicious and authentic Mexican experience in Munich.

Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sao Paulo fell short of expectations. Broth, ordinarily rich and savory in tonkotsu ramen, was instead bland and watery. Noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. Toppings were less than generous in quantity. The only redeeming quality was the tender and flavorful pork belly. It is advisable to bypass this restaurant for those desiring an authentic and fulfilling ramen experience.

Guac n' Roll truck's menu selections, such as the Three Taco Combo Plate, Veggie Taco Bowl, and Chicken Burrito, left a positive impression. The tacos, full of flavor and expertly assembled, boasted fresh ingredients and a lavish serving of guacamole. A refreshing vegetarian choice, the veggie taco bowl, brimmed with crisp veggies and a savory sauce. The chicken burrito, a filling and satisfying wrap, showcased tender chicken, crisp veggies, and a zesty sauce. In summary, Guac n' Roll's food was scrumptious and fairly priced, establishing it as a favorite among Sao Paulo locals.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sao Paulo offered a balance of flavors, each with its unique twist. The Creamy Chicken Ramen boasted a rich, velvety broth that nicely complemented the tender chicken, while the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen provided a satisfying kick with its flavorful miso base and assortment of fresh vegetables. However, the noodles in both dishes could have been a bit more al dente for a better texture. Overall, it was a decent dining experience with room for improvement.

Overcooked Combo Lo Mein lacked the anticipated freshness, with the Chinese street food experience at The Peking Truck in Sao Paulo falling short. The Combo Fried Rice was similarly disappointing, its overpowering soy sauce flavor overshadowing the other ingredients. The Wonton Soup, a previous favorite, was served lukewarm and its wontons were soggy. The Bottled Water and Bottled Soda failed to provide the desired chill. Unfortunately, this meal did not meet the expectation of authentic Chinese cuisine.

Disappointment was the main course at Peking Truck in Cape Town. The Wonton Soup lacked flavor and the wontons were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The Combo Fried Rice was equally underwhelming, with a bland taste and an overabundance of rice compared to the scarce vegetables and protein. The overall experience did not live up to the expectations of a Chinese cuisine. I would not recommend this food truck to anyone seeking authentic and delicious Chinese food.

Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese was a culinary disappointment. The mac and cheese was dry and powdery instead of the promised creaminess. The cheese lacked flavor and was unappetizing. The buffalo sauce was excessively sweet and sticky. The food truck's ambiance was cramped and smoky. The service was unfriendly and uninviting. Based on this experience, I would not advise others to try Mac Shack.

The menu offerings of The Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck, specifically the Chicago Dog and the Coney Dog, showcase the culinary strengths of the Windy City. Named after the classic Chicago hot dog, the Chicago Dog features a poppy seed bun, all-beef hot dog, tomato, lettuce, onion, and pickles, all coming together to create a taste that is distinctly Midwestern. The Coney Dog, a nod to the iconic hot dog vendor, boasts a traditional chili, cheese, and onions combination. Although the buns were slightly dry, the hot dogs themselves were juicy and packed with flavor. Overall, The Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck is a great spot for those looking to sample a taste of Chicago while in Cape Town.

The Freezing Point truck in Cape Town offered a variety of ice cream options, which was appreciated. The Lemonade was refreshing, and the Sugar Cone and Waffle Cone were crisp and tasty. The Two Scoop Bowl was a generous portion, perfect for sharing. The Bottled Water and Bottled Soda were standard. The Ice Cream Sandwich, however, was a bit underwhelming, with the cookie being slightly too hard. Overall, a decent experience with room for improvement in some areas.

This order was a complete disappointment. The food was cold and the portions were small. The Lo Mein and Fried Rice were overcooked and the wonton soup was bland. The bottled water and soda were overpriced. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The smoky BBQ truck, Smoky BBQ, located in Warsaw, offers a mouthwatering selection of BBQ fare. I sampled their pulled pork sandwich, which was tender and flavorful, with a perfect balance of smoky and sweet notes. The accompanying spring mix salad was fresh and crisp, while the bottled water and soda quenched my thirst. The rack of pork ribs was succulent and tender, though I found the accompanying sides to be a bit lacking. Overall, Smoky BBQ provides a satisfying and flavorful BBQ experience, but could benefit from more substantial sides.

The Peking Truck's menu offerings of combo lo mein, combo fried rice, and wonton soup were a taste of heaven. The lo mein and fried rice were perfectly balanced with fresh, savory ingredients, while the wonton soup was a steaming bowl of deliciousness. The portions were generous, and the service was friendly. Overall, I had a memorable culinary journey at the Peking Truck, and I highly recommend it to anyone seeking authentic Chinese cuisine in the heart of New York City.

Save your money and time and give this truck a miss."

The Cheeky Greek truck in Rio de Janeiro failed to deliver on its promise of authentic Gyros. The Gyro Plate was disappointingly dry and lackluster, missing the expected burst of flavors. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype of a Gyros menu.

The Lean Beef Tibs from Tasty Tibs in Rio de Janeiro was an absolute delight. The tender beef, vibrant spices, and flavorful sauce transported me to the heart of Ethiopia. The portions were generous and the service was friendly. I particularly enjoyed the traditional Ethiopian coffee, which was smooth and aromatic. Overall, I highly recommend this restaurant for anyone seeking an authentic and flavorful Ethiopian experience.

A delightful Taco Combo Plate from Guac n' Roll truck. Ingredients in the tacos were fresh and full of flavor. Guacamole was smooth and creamy in texture. Meat was tender and cooked to perfection. Warm and pliable tortillas completed the dish. Balanced and satisfying overall taste, an ideal meal to savor while taking in Rio de Janeiro's scenic vistas.

Disappointment was the main course with my order of "The Kitchen Sink" from Revenge of the Curds in Munich. The poutine, a dish I usually love, was a letdown. The toppings were unbalanced, with an overwhelming amount of one ingredient and not enough of others. The presentation was also lackluster. Overall, this was not the culinary adventure I was hoping for.

The Peking Truck's menu offerings of combo lo mein and fried rice were a satisfying treat for my taste buds. "Better Off Bread truly lives up to its name! The Pastrami sandwich was a gastronomical delight, perfectly seasoned and cooked to perfection.
